conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of objects A and B to determine when they are farthest apart.
The position is the integral of velocity over time.
Distance between objects at any time t is given by the integral of their velocity over time.
Distance is maximized when the velocity of object A is greater than that of object B.
Identify the time t2 at which the velocity of object A is greater than that of object B.
Time t2 is when the distance between them is the greatest.
The two objects are farthest apart at time t2.
